tagline: Fall gravel in the Flint Hills. The off-season Unbound you can actually get into.

course.terrain_type: Classic Flint Hills gravel—same roads as Unbound
course.terrain_surface: Chunky limestone gravel, some paved connectors, maintained county roads
course.signature_challenge: The wind. Fall in Kansas means consistent 15-25 mph winds. Half your race is headwind. The other half is beautiful.
course.character: The Flint Hills you know (or want to know) without June's heat. Rolling, relentless, beautiful.

suffering_zones.label: Reality Check
suffering_zones.desc: The rollers are adding up. Legs are talking.

suffering_zones.label: Wind Games
suffering_zones.desc: Open prairie means exposure. Wind direction determines your fate.

suffering_zones.label: Closing Miles
suffering_zones.desc: You can see the finish but the hills don't stop coming.

course.climate_description: October in Kansas means cool mornings, mild afternoons, and chance of everything from Indian summer to early freeze

biased_opinion.summary: The Rad is perfect if you want to experience Emporia gravel without the Unbound commitment. Same roads, same community, cooler temps, lower stakes. It's also a great prep race if you're building toward Unbound the following June.

logistics.parking: Much easier than Unbound. Ample space near start.

searchable_text: The Rad Dirt Fest Fall gravel in the Flint Hills. The off-season Unbound you can actually get into. The Flint Hills you know (or want to know) without June's heat. Rolling, relentless, beautiful. The wind. Fall in Kansas means consistent 15-25 mph winds. Half your race is headwind. The other half is beautiful. Rolling hills Cattle guards Open prairie exposure Creek bed crossings Emporia, Kansas Lyon County Late fall Midwest Classic Flint Hills gravel—same roads as Unbound
